comment.body: @Moor: I like the style of that guy
@Moor: the whole glow-the-dark CIA nigger saga is something I still joke about with friends. That and the god likes elephants quote. it's really sad he passed away

I'm on Tor and I see 460 on ZeroHello

Good! The best cybersecurity is not using any computers ;-)

How to protect yourself online:
1. Don't have a computer
2. If you do have to own one, don't plug it in
3. If you do have to plug it in, disable networking
That's what happens if instead of eating cookies, you work out. Good on him. Should probably have gone for a more balanced routine though...

@Styromaniac: I learned that from my Information Security professor at Uni in his 101 lecture. As for breaking into system he told us something along the lines of «Encryption is hard, it takes a lot of brains and calculations. Unless you absolutely have to, don't bother trying to break it. Humans are much easier to break: fingers and toes can hurt a lot, throwing some money in the bureaucratic cogs is another effective way to break security. People are generally ill-informed and naïve, tell them confidently you're from IT and there's a problem you need their help with, chances are they'll just give you whatever it is you need without a second thought.»

Most companies do a lot better these days at teaching employees how to handle calls from "IT" though, so it's not as effective anymore. Doesn't mean it isn't worth a try.

all.css isn't downloading for me on that zite? Anyone else experience that problem?

@Krystof: I'm assuming the site's fine on your end? If so try signing it again.

PS I'm currently working on a project for ZeroNet that I hope to publish somewhere mid-december, but I'd be willing to contribute (code) after that.

if you're on Tor Browser there's sadly no way to do so on ZeroMe because it uses Canvas elements to process the images, there's ways around this that zites like Millchan and 1+Gallery use, but the developer of ZeroMe hasn't implemented this yet. You could either temporarily use a browser that supports and doesn't block Canvas elements to upload your profile pic, then switch back, or you'll have to wait it out until an fix is made.
@caryoscelus: disabling canvas blocking didn't do it for me, but maybe I just did it wrong. Manually adding it would work, don't recommend the hassle though.

yes I dream of Steam, but it's a ZeroNet zite. Download your game in ZeroNet, download mods, maps and all that stuff in ZN, find people to play with on ZN, discuss the game, write guides etc. Things like Leaderboards, Achievements etc. would be a bit harder to implement though, but do we really need those?
I honestly prefer TERFs over the LGBTQ+ activists. At least they aren't denying science.

>[chromosomes are] entirely unrelated to one's biological sex
that's what I mean
@Kaffie: Yes, they are defective males. In the same way that physiologically having a tail doesn't make one a monkey.

> @Styromaniac: we know the science entirely
Talk about hubris.
"Look at this chromosomal exception, therefore cutting my dick off and inserting silicone in my chest makes me a woman now!" is not exactly a convincing argument. It's self mutilation. Transexuals should be taught to accept themselves for what they are, not chopped up and glued to fit their delusional self-image.
I won't go as far to say he should be killed, but I'm sure he'd taste great with some thyme.
What about the right to offend/right not to be offended argument?
I don't fully agree, but this definitely hits close.
sadly it's too late now
Don't do anything stupid (without posting pics or streaming it). But seriously don't.
yes, that would be good

@Quantumworld: Man, I have that nightmare too sometimes. And then there's the one where Suze Wozniak demonizes all the money in my wallet whenever I am at a cash register. Or Mark Zucc comes to my birthday party and tells all of my friends and family about every stupid thing I've ever said or done while a man with an "NSA" hat is quietly making notes in the corner. When I call tech support for a computer problem Gill Bates comes visit me he tells me I'm running a backdoored pirated version of Fedora and installs a free copy of Windows E that refuses to start unless I chant "All Hail Corporatism". Lately it's mostly be Alev Loss who just stands next to my router and unplugs it whenever I post a meme, so I have to get a hammer and hit him over the head before he turns it back on again. It's definitely been getting worse recently.

It will inevitably happen. If KxoBot or anyone else wants to segregate themselves from the rest of us, so be it, it's their choice. If they want to help other people do the same, as long as they consent to it, no problem.
I think it's stupid to go around blocking people for their views, and I suggest we point and laugh at those who do so.
